body.p:
Prestonsburg Ky
Jan 14th 1861
To His Excellency
Beriah Magoffin Governer of Ky

Your Petitioner Jonathan Jones would respectfully represent that at the Decr Term of the Floyd Circuit Court 1860 he was tried and fined the sum of $50,00 for the alledged offense of carrying concealed a deadly weapon other than an ordinary Pockett Knife,, He states he had been in the state of Ohio among abolitionists and had while there as a pro slavery man carried a pistol ^Knife^ for his own nesessary defense and on his way home he carried the pistolKnife but not concealed at any time and the witness Benjamin Hamilton swore the Same,, yet he was fined by the Jury the Sum above named, and -- the Petitioner now and at the time believed it was done by some mistake that prevailed among Jury trying him he says he did not in Kentucky carry sd Pistol ^Knife^ Concealed Wherefore he says he was not Guilty of the offense charged he therefore prays your Excellency to remit the Sd fine and for all proper relief
Jonathan Jones says the statements in the foregoing Petition are true
Sworn to before me by Jonathan Jones this 14th Jan 1861
Wm T Salyer Exam J P

Dear Governor this Petition states substantially the truth and We hope you will remit Mr Jones fine he is a reliable and Clever Gent and would not in our opinion swear a lie for any consideration how is Ce secession received at the capitol among the members let us hear from you

yours with much
Respect
Elliott & John M Burns

Floyd Cir. ct
Remitted
B. M
$50 } Weapon
J Jones
Issd Jan 29. 1861
